summary: This is a forwarded email from a DOJ official to another recipient, relaying early information from the Washington Post that Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell the previous night, possibly due to a suicide attempt. The sender offers to be available for discussion.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email; reported to have been found unresponsive in his cell, possibly from a suicide attempt.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell, with early reports suggesting a possible suicide attempt.

keyFacts: The Washington Post was hearing that Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell on the night of July 22, 2019.
The incident was initially characterized as a possible suicide attempt.
The information was being relayed internally within the U.S. Department of Justice, specifically the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The email shows early, unofficial reporting of the event that preceded Epstein's confirmed death.
